concise_definition: v. 尊重, 顾及, 遵守 (respect 的现在分词形式)

definitions.explanation_en: To show consideration, admiration, or deference toward someone or something, often due to their value, authority, or rights.
definitions.explanation_cn: 对某人或某事物表现出尊重、敬意或顺从，通常是因为其价值、权威或权利。
definitions.example_en: We must be respecting the privacy of our clients at all times.
definitions.example_cn: 我们必须始终尊重客户的隐私。

definitions.explanation_en: To comply with or honor a rule, boundary, or agreement, even when inconvenient or challenging.
definitions.explanation_cn: 即使在不便或具有挑战性的情况下，仍遵守或尊重某项规则、界限或协议。
definitions.example_en: The new policy requires respecting the designated quiet hours in the dormitory.
definitions.example_cn: 新政策要求遵守宿舍的指定安静时间。

definitions.explanation_en: To acknowledge the legitimacy or importance of a perspective, belief, or tradition, even if one does not share it.
definitions.explanation_cn: 承认某种观点、信仰或传统的正当性或重要性，即使自己并不认同。
definitions.example_en: She is respectful of cultural differences, even when she doesn't fully understand them.
definitions.example_cn: 即使她并不完全理解，她仍尊重文化差异。

comparison.analysis: “Honoring” (尊崇) 更强调一种庄重、正式的敬意，常用于仪式、承诺或传统语境，如“honoring a promise”（信守诺言）。“Respecting” 更广泛，涵盖日常行为中的礼貌与认可，不一定带有仪式感。
“Acknowledging” (承认) 仅表示认知或确认某事物的存在或事实，不必然包含情感上的尊重。例如，你可以承认一个人的观点，但不尊重它。而 “respecting” 暗示了价值判断和积极态度。
“Obeying” (服从) 强调对权威或命令的机械性遵从，常带有强制性或权力关系。“Respecting” 则是出于内在认同或价值观的自愿行为，更强调主观态度而非外在服从。
